body: For me, volar quits on first save to the buffer.

I'm not able to reproduce. I get this log:

```
[START][2024-02-11 17:38:33] LSP logging initiated
[WARN][2024-02-11 17:38:33] ...lsp/handlers.lua:573	"No typescript found, vue-language-server will not work."
[WARN][2024-02-11 17:38:33] ...lsp/handlers.lua:134	"The language server bugged-volar triggers a registerCapability handler for workspace/didChangeWorkspaceFolders despite dynamicRegistration set to false. Report upstream, this warning is harmless"
```

I followed the steps to install `vue-language-server` (not in the OP) [here](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/doc/server_configurations.md#volar) with `npm install -g @vue/language-server`

Adding `tsdk = "node_modules/typescript/lib"` gives me an LSP log of:

```
[START][2024-02-11 17:57:03] LSP logging initiated
[WARN][2024-02-11 17:57:03] ...lsp/handlers.lua:134	"The language server bugged-volar triggers a registerCapability handler for workspace/didChangeWorkspaceFolders despite dynamicRegistration set to false. Report upstream, this warning is harmless"
```

Using the default config in nvim-lspconfig results in the same.
Ah I can reproduce now by saving the buffer with the config in nvim-lspconfig

repository.name: neovim
repository.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

body: @lewis6991 I can confirm that #27427 indeed fixes Volar's crash for me. Thank you so much!
I manually required lsp.handlers in my neovim so I expect this to also work.

Can confirm this is working :D 

Thank you for the fix
